did.unittitle: Mary Gilson "Impressions of the British Industrial Situation Subsequent to the General Strike" Manuscript
did.abstract: "Impressions of the British Industrial Situation Subsequent to the General Strike, Summer of 1926," by Mary B. Gilson.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a photocopy of "Impressions of the British Industrial Situation Subsequent to the General Strike, Summer of 1926," by Mary B. Gilson.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Mary Gilson "Impressions of the British Industrial Situation Subsequent to the General Strike" Manuscript #6006m. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mary Barnett Gilson was an economist at the University of Chicago, 1931-1942, and a specialist in industrial relations with various private companies and government agencies. She retired to Chapel Hill, N.C., in the 1940s.
